column1: Narrator : As far as the eye can see, the island is covered with pine trees. The trees are so close to each other it’s hard to see what’s ahead.

column2: PlayerSpeak : I know this labyrinth inside out!

column6: Narrator : The leaves in the trees and the fog are getting thicker. It's extremely hard to see anything, a real labyrinth.
column7: Narrator : CAPITAINE remembers these rocks, roots and pine trees. They've seen them 5 times by now. The crew is going in circles, it’s a real labyrinth.
column8: Narrator : A drop prevents the crew from going further. From the top of the cliff, pine trees as far as CAPITAINE can see. Neither NOMBATEAU or the ocean can be spotted on the horizon. A real labyrinth.

column2: PlayerSpeak : It’s out of the question.
PlayerSpeak : I’m not stepping into this labyrinth ever again.

column1: Narrator :  CAPITAINE is getting further away from NOMBATEAU, the top of its tallest mast barely visible now behind the massive trees.
Narrator :  The crew reaches a crossing. Three paths are offered to CAPITAINE, separated by a dead twisted tree and a big mossy rock.
Narrator : A massive cliff is split in two in front of the crew. CAPITAINE can also faintly hear a water stream in the distance.
Narrator : After walking for what felt like hours, the crew finally steps outside of the crack. A wheat field stretches in front of them.
Narrator : The top of pine trees can be seen to the east. It's impossible to see what's to the west as a thick fog covers the area.
Narrator : The fog dissipates and uncovers a clearing. A river covered in dead leaves is flowing in the middle of it.
Narrator : A grassy plain stretches before the crew. Far to the distance to the east, CAPITAINE sees what appears to be a swamp, and to the west, a gigantic weeping willow.
Narrator : CAPITAINE ventures into the swamp, which gets thicker with each step but still manageable... until a wall as tall as NOMBATEAU is blocking the way. The only way through is a closed gate.
column2: Narrator : CAPITAINE is in the swamp, but a wall as tall as NOMBATEAU is blocking the way. The only way through is a closed gate.

column1: Narrator : A dark and gloomy voice echoes from behind the trees.

column3: Narrator : A big rumble echoes through the swamp, scattering away a few frogs.
column4: Narrator : « You have spoken all the words »

column3: Narrator : « You have spoken the right word »
PlayerSpeak : I think we’re getting closer!

column1: Narrator : Without too much trouble, the crew retrace their steps to the forest’s entrance.
Narrator : CAPITAINE stands before a deep and dark hole.
Narrator : Without too much trouble, the crew retrace their steps to the forest’s entrance.
Narrator : After falling for a few seconds, CAPITAINE and the crew end up into an underground lake.
Narrator : The whole cave is lit by a dim blue light coming from a rocky corridor.
Narrator : On the walls, a crack is letting through a beam of sunlight.
Narrator : CAPITAINE and the crew are back on the beach.
Narrator : They turn around but it's too late, the crack closes behind them, like a cut turning into a scar.
Narrator : The corridor leads to a massive room, carved in the rock. In the middle of it is a platform with a big shiny chest on top.
Narrator : As CAPITAINE steps on the platform, the walls start to rumble. A deafening clap of thunder cracks, as a blinding flash of light forces everybody to cover their eyes.
Narrator : When they regain their senses, four men with putrid faces are holding bloody swords right behind CAPITAINE.
OtherSpeak : This is the end of you, mortals.
Narrator : The cave has gone perfectly silent, except for the very faint singing of birds in the distance, heard from a hole in the ceiling.
Narrator : CAPITAINE ‘s dream is right in front of them.
Narrator : A gigantic chest, carved with runic engravings, is beaming with a blinding blaze.
Choice : (go back to the center of the cave)
